about.title: About Me
about.description: I'm an advanced student of Information Systems Engineering and work as a Front-End Developer. I'm passionate about learning in technology and computing, always driven by my love for aesthetics and design, which I aim to reflect in every digital experience.
about.languages: Advanced English · Basic Italian, French and Portuguese

items.title: Front-End Developer
items.description: Development of a financial portal using React, TypeScript and user-focused design.

items.title: Retail Analyst / IT Support
items.description: Technology assistance and support in retail and management control processes for the group’s companies.

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: Feel free to reach out! I'm always open to new opportunities and collaborations.

understanding.title: Understand before acting
understanding.desc: Before looking for solutions, I like to thoroughly understand the problem. Every business has its own dynamics and needs, so knowing the context is key to doing useful and tailored work.

communication.title: Clear and constant communication
communication.desc: To keep things running smoothly, communication with the team is essential. I'm always available to coordinate, share progress, or resolve doubts, and I strive to leave nothing unclear.

research.title: Research and apply, always as a team
research.desc: My way of working is to research what I don’t know and apply it right away. Learning has to be tied to practice, and sharing the process with others always improves it.

now.title: Do today what can be done today
now.desc: I try not to leave tasks pending if I can solve them now. In development, postponing small things can complicate the big ones, so I like to keep the workflow clean.

professionalism.title: Professionalism with humility
professionalism.desc: Work should not be taken personally. I strive to remain professional, calm, and open to learning. If I make a mistake, I own it, correct it, and see it as part of the journey.

user.title: Think like a user
user.desc: In frontend, what we create is directly experienced by users. That’s why it must not only work, but also be clear, pleasant, understandable, and accessible. I always try to put myself in the user’s shoes.
